page.title: 10AN OLD HARWICH TRADITION
page.content: ON THE FIRST SATURDAY OF NOVEMBER THE GUY CARNIVAL TAKES PLACE.IT STARTS AT 6.30pm AND ABOUT 40 FLOATS AND 350 BIGHEADS AND COLLECTORS MARCH THROUGH THE TOWN.THE MONEY COLLECTED IS FOR LOCAL CHARITES.THERE ARE SEVERAL BANDS AND MAJORETTE GROUPS.THE HARLEQUIN MAJORETTES WERE FOUNDED 4 YEARS AGO.THEY DO 2 MARCHING ROUTINES TO MUSIC IN THE CARNIVAL AND 2 DANCE ROUTINES FOR FETES.THE UNIFORM IS GREEN AND WHITE AND THEY USE POM-POMS,MACES AND BATONS TOO.THE FLOATS MAKE FUN OF LOCAL AND NATIONAL PEOPLE AND EVENTS.THEY GO IN PROCESSION THROUGH THE TOWN TO UPPER DOVERCOURT AND BACK TO HARWICH BY 10.00pm.THERE ARE PRIZES FOR THE BEST FLOATS, FANCY DRESS AND BIGHEADS.
